name: biota
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the animals and plants living in a particular place, time, or habitat (= one type of natural environment): Scientists will try to determine what effects the chemical pollutants have on soil biota.
More examplesFewer examplesOne issue is the possible transfer of foreign biota to other rivers and lakes affected by the outlet.Fragile flora and river biota can be unwittingly destroyed in the zeal to experience the great outdoors. More than half of the large mammal biota of the Americas disappeared in a cataclysmic extinction wave at the very end of the Pleistocene Era.He instantly loved Madagascar's warm, Afro-Asian culture and exotic biota.A 2015 biota study found no major invasive species in the lake.
